title: Twitter takes down Trump video trolling Biden over son's overseas money ties
text:
A video attack against Joe Biden that Donald Trump tweeted on Wednesday disappeared from his feed overnight, after representatives of Nickelback made a copyright infringement claim against the president.

The band's song 'Photograph' is the backdrop for the 20-second clip, created to push back against the former vice president's claim that he knows nothing about his son Hunter's foreign corporate ties.

'I have never spoken to my son about his overseas business dealings,' the elder Biden says in the video, followed by a photograph that purports to debunk him.

In place of the video, Trump's social media fans now see a curt message: 'This media has been disabled in response to a report by the copyright owner.'

Hours after Twitter zapped the video, Trump supporters deluged Twitter with their own posts of the video and the hashtag '#ParodyIsFairUse' – which trended on the platform by mid-morning.

President Trump's posting of a parody video mocking former VP Joe Biden went dark Wednesday night after representatives of the band Nickelback complaint to Twitter that it used a snippet of their song 'Photograph' without permission

The video Trump posted Wednesday included a clip of Biden denying he had ever spoken with his son Hunter about his foreign business ties

The Trump video's creator took footage from the Nickelback music video and inserted a group photo including Biden and his son Hunter along with a third man (at left), Devon Archer, who was Hunter Biden's business partner and co-board-member at a Ukrainian gas company

Not sure why Twitter wouldn’t want you to “Look at this Photograph”,' Donald Trump Jr. tweeted.

The photo featured in the video, thought to date to 2014, grabbed international attention on Wednesday because the four people pictured on a golf course include both Bidens, and a man labeled a 'Ukraine oil executive.'

That third person is Devon Archer, a former business partner of Hunter Biden. Both men served on the board of directors of Burisma Holdings, a natural gas company in the former Soviet Bloc country.

Hunter Biden was paid $50,000 per month for his service, at a time when Ukrainian prosecutors were invetigating corruption in the company.

President Trump has highlighted Joe Biden's public claim that he once threatened to scuttle $1 billion in U.S. loan guarantees if Ukraine's government didn't fire the lead prosecutor.

Twitter trends on Thursday morning included '#ParodyIsFairUse' as Trump fans began posting their own copies of the video, seeming to dare the social media platform to take them all down

Donald Trump Jr. reposted the deleted video himself, along with a suggestion that Twitter bucked to Nickelback's pressure too quickly

'I looked at them and said: "I’m leaving in six hours. If the prosecutor is not fired, you’re not getting the money",' the former VP recalled in a January 2018 speech. 'Well, son of a b***h. He got fired. And they put in place someone who was solid at the time.'

Hunter Biden has acknowledged 'once' speaking with his father about his foreign money ties. And a week after the pair flew aboard Air force Two to China in 2016, a venture capital fund the younger Biden oversaw got a $1.5 billion cash infusion from investors through the Bank of China.

Current Ukrainian officials have not accused either Biden of wrongdoing in connection with Burisma. Former Ukrainian Prosecutor General Yuri Lutsenko told The Washington Post last week that 'from the perspective of Ukrainian legislation, [Hunter Biden] did not violate anything.'

The president's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani, however, tells a different story.

President Donald Trump has trolled Joe Biden for weeks over his part in the swirling Ukraine controversy

He wrote in notes from a January 2019 phone call with the fired prosecutor, Viktor Shokin, that Shokin claimed he was forced to back off his investigation into Burisma.

Shokin, who was himseld accused of rampant corruption during his time in office, told Giuliani he stopped his probe 'out of fear of the United States' after America's top diplomat told him to use 'white gloves.'

'According to Mr. Shokin, that implied do nothing,' Giuliani's notes say.

Shokin, he wrote, recalled being told that Joe Biden was holding up aid payments to Ukraine because of the investigation.

The Nickelback song featured in the 'Photograph' video includes the lyrics: 'Look at this photograph, every time I do it makes me laugh.'

Spin.com reports that the ensuing line 'And what the hell is on Joey’s head' is an apparently reference to Joe Biden's hair plugs.
description: A video attack against Biden that Trump tweeted disappeared from his feed after representatives of the band Nickelback made a copyright infringement claim against the president.
